MUNPLANET

What is MUNPlanet?



MUNPlanet is an interactive platform that allows its members to share knowledge and build MUN connections globally. It serves as an information centre where the users can engage themselves in various discussions, ask questions and exchange views over certain topics.
It helps MUN Delegates and conference organisers to exchange information concerning the process of advancing the culture of MUNing, spreading the story about why it’s necessary and helps in developing leadership skills.
It is for people who are passionate about world affairs and share the values of the United Nations. It promotes interaction among people who make up for an association that benefit its members.


Why MUNPlanet?

Over the past years, MUNPlanet has introduced tools that helps one to find new conferences, opportunities, internships and much more. MUNers are using MUNPlanet to,
-> Discuss ways in which we can accelerate progress.
-> Stay updated on all MUN dates and conferences.
-> Tap into the collective knowledge and connections of the MUN delegates.
-> Find out what it takes to build a successful Model UN conference.
-> Find answers related to MUNs and career growth.
-> Connect with some of the best projects.
-> Find jobs related to MUN expertise.
-> Build a global MUN network.
-> Find an experienced MUN and career mentor.
-> Benefit from being a MUN alumni.
-> Find partners for new projects or ventures.
-> Get inside information on potential employers.


What is it’s significance?

It persists over social media, making people aware of the current affairs and world politics. Also, it involves people by asking their opinions and views, hence maintaining a connection and updating its users regarding recent news MUN circuit.


Why MUNPlanet and JECRC MUN’17?

MUNPlanet is a knowledge network where members create, curate and share their knowledge and experiences about issues of global importance.
JECRC MUN 2017 wants to spread the idea of MUNPlanet and make people familiar with this platform where the members can, not only discuss a wide range of topics that are related to the functioning of The United Nations but also others, such as the climate change topics, international relations, food security, and many more.
